snippet: The 1972 showdown between Boris Spassky and Bobby Fischer led to an explosion of interest in the game, and when Fischer won the title he became an international celebrity.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column observes that the 1972 showdown between Boris Spassky and Bobby Fischer led to an explosion of interest in the game, and when Fischer won the title he became an international celebrity.
lead_paragraph: The 1972 showdown between Boris Spassky and Bobby Fischer led to an explosion of interest in the game, and when Fischer won the title he became an international celebrity.

headline.print_headline: 40 Years Ago, a Match Took the World by Storm
headline.seo: Chess: Fischer and Spassky, Looking Back
headline.main: 40 Years Ago, a Match Took the World by Storm
